pullRequest.body:
Preparatory lemmas towards proving that the real interval $[x,y]$ has boundary {x,y} as a smooth manifold.

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:

- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [6bb65013e5](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15890/commits/6bb65013e5df861f9c01e4e53857000c85490624)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ closure_halfspace`
`+ frontier_halfspace`
`+ frontier_range_modelWithCornersEuclideanHalfSpace`
`+ instance [NeZero n] : Inhabited (EuclideanHalfSpace n)`
`+ instance [NeZero n] : TopologicalSpace (EuclideanHalfSpace n)`
`+ interior_halfspace`
`+ interior_range_modelWithCornersEuclideanHalfSpace`
`+ range_modelWithCornersEuclideanHalfSpace`
`- instance [Zero (Fin n)] : Inhabited (EuclideanHalfSpace n)`
`- instance [Zero (Fin n)] : TopologicalSpace (EuclideanHalfSpace n)`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
Thanks for the useful feedback! I have addressed all comments.
Also, I would argue the first 3 lemmas should be `@[simp]` and that the `p`, `a`, and `i` arguments should be explicit.
Thanks again; all comments have been addressed.

Hmmm... I didn't realize they were littered throughout (my fault!).

@sgouezel can you explain the preference this file has for `[Zero (Fin n)]` over `[NeZero n]`? It seems a strange choice to me.
I guess it dates back to the time where `NeZero n` wasn't a thing yet. `[NeZero n]` is clearly better.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10435806113/job/28900151963)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10435806113/job/28900152007)
Thanks for the fast reviews!

```suggestion
  let f : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin n) →L[ℝ] ℝ := ContinuousLinearMap.proj i
```
and below

Why not do this now? I think it's relatively easy (note: I also don't like the `change` utilizing the defeq there).
```lean
open ENNReal in
theorem interior_halfspace {a : ℝ} {n : ℕ} {p : ℝ≥0∞} (i : Fin n) :
    interior { y : PiLp p (fun _ : Fin n ↦ ℝ) | a ≤ y i } = { y | a < y i } := by
  let f : PiLp p (fun _ : Fin n ↦ ℝ) →L[ℝ] ℝ := ContinuousLinearMap.proj i
  simpa [interior_Ici] using f.interior_preimage (Function.surjective_eval _) (Ici a)
```
This allows your lemma as a corollary, even using `with_reducible` since `EuclideanSpace` is an `abbrev`
```lean
example {a : ℝ} {n : ℕ} (i : Fin n) :
    interior { y : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin n) | a ≤ y i } = { y | a < y i } := by
  with_reducible exact interior_halfspace i
```
Finally, I'm not sure I understand the choices behind your use of explicit / implicit variables here. Why is `i` explicit but `a` and `n` implicit?

I was thinking of allowing different component spaces... in which case I'd even need to think about the statement.
I like your generalisation and proof, thanks!

I had simply overlooked that i could be implicit as well, and just made it so.

```suggestion
    closure { y : PiLp p (fun _ : Fin n ↦ ℝ) | a ≤ y i } = { y | a ≤ y i } := by
```

```suggestion
    frontier { y : PiLp p (fun _ : Fin n ↦ ℝ) | a ≤ y i } = { y | a = y i } := by
```

```suggestion
  rw [frontier, closure_halfspace, interior_halfspace]
```
you only needed `p` because it was not part of the statement without my corrections above.
:facepalm: Indeed, thanks for reading properly!

Here and below, I think the correct approach is probably to use `(n+1)` everywhere instead of (or else take an `[NeZero n]` hypothesis as I've suggested below).
```suggestion
lemma range_modelWithCornersEuclideanHalfSpace (n : ℕ) [NeZero n]
```
Done; I have performed the same change to the other instances in this file.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: interior, closure and frontier of Euclidean half-spaces
